page.title: 07Recreation on Penn Common
page.content: Penn Common is a very large area, mostly used as a golf course. Also, there are many public footpaths, some which lead round the course. The remainder which isnt used as a golf course is used as grazing land for cattle. Recently, an incident occured here golfers were using cattle of a localfarmer for target practice. He has complained to the golf club to leave him enough land for grazing while the golf club are trying to stop him from grazing his cattle on the fairways. Along the paths we went on there was one inn,"The Barley Mow". I like Penn Common and think we are lucky to have a large area of common land near a town. The golf course takes up 52 of the 132 acres, there are mixed opinions in my class whether the golf course should be reduced in size in years to come.
